extends BaseService
implements IContactService

The actual contact entity is not deleted using this call.

Method Detail

getContacts

public ResultSet<Contact> getContacts(java.lang.String accessToken,
                                      java.lang.Integer limit,
                                      java.lang.String modifiedSinceTimestamp,
                                      Contact.Status status)
                               throws ConstantContactServiceException
Gets the contacts for the current user.
Implements the get Contacts operation of the Contacts API by calling the ConstantContact server side.

Specified by:
getContacts in interface IContactService
Parameters:
accessToken - Constant Contact OAuth2 access token.
limit - Limit.
modifiedSinceTimestamp - This time stamp is an ISO-8601 ordinal date supporting offset.
It will return only the contacts modified since the supplied date.
If you want to bypass this filter set modifiedSinceTimestamp to null.
status - The status of contacts to return.
Returns:
A ResultSet of Contact containing data as returned by the server on success;
An exception is thrown otherwise.
Throws:
ConstantContactServiceException - When something went wrong in the Constant Contact flow or an error is returned from server.

deleteContactFromLists

public boolean deleteContactFromLists(java.lang.String accessToken,
                                      java.lang.String contactId)
                               throws ConstantContactServiceException
Deletes a single contact from all the lists belonging the current user, based on the contact id.
The actual contact entity is not deleted using this call.
Implements the delete Contact From Lists (all lists) operation of the Contacts API by calling the ConstantContact server side.

Specified by:
deleteContactFromLists in interface IContactService
Parameters:
accessToken - Constant Contact OAuth2 access token.
contactId - Contact id to be removed from all the lists.
Returns:
Returns true if operation succeeded; an exception is thrown otherwise.
Throws:
ConstantContactServiceException - When something went wrong in the Constant Contact flow or an error is returned from server.

deleteContactFromList

public boolean deleteContactFromList(java.lang.String accessToken,
                                     java.lang.String contactId,
                                     java.lang.String listId)
                              throws ConstantContactServiceException
Deletes a single contact from a single list belonging the current user, based on the contact id and the list id.
The actual contact entity is not deleted using this call.
Implements the delete Contact From List (a specific list) operation of the Contacts API by calling the ConstantContact server side.

Specified by:
deleteContactFromList in interface IContactService
Parameters:
accessToken - Constant Contact OAuth2 access token.
contactId - Contact id to be removed.
listId - ContactList to remove the contact from.
Returns:
Returns true if operation succeeded; an exception is thrown otherwise.
Throws:
ConstantContactServiceException - When something went wrong in the Constant Contact flow or an error is returned from server.

updateContact

public Contact updateContact(java.lang.String accessToken,
                             Contact contact,
                             java.lang.Boolean actionByVisitor)
                      throws ConstantContactServiceException
Updates a single contact for the current user, based on the contact id.
Implements the update Contact operation of the Contacts API by calling the ConstantContact server side.
A specific contact is identified by its internal id.

Specified by:
updateContact in interface IContactService
Parameters:
accessToken - Constant Contact OAuth2 access token.
contact - Contact to be updated.
Returns:
Returns the updated Contact containing data as returned by the server on success;
An exception is thrown otherwise.
Throws:
ConstantContactServiceException - When something went wrong in the Constant Contact flow or an error is returned from server.
